attributes.action: ensure the real and full cost of student loans is made fully transparent to potential students prior to starting their degree courses
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The current information provided to students and their parents is misleading. It is suggested that the loan is interest free and only increases in line with inflation.

Although true, it does not make clear that a student leaving university with a £20k plus loan will see their loan increase by around  £100 per month (compounded).

These crippling increases are further "hidden" by examples suggesting that a newly qualified student earning £18k p.a. pays off their loan at a rate of around £30 per month.

Such a "payment" does not even service the interest and their loan will continue to increase by around £70 per month under those circumstances

Information given to prospective students should clearly identify the annual salary required to service a maximum loan so students can make an informed decision about whether the costs of obtaining a degree are sustainable and worthwhile
